column4: hey guys, I have issues setting up a Realtek based Ethernet Card. I need to setup dhcp3-server on it. However I don't think Ubuntu is even detecting the card correctly. Any ideas? Also Firefox doesn't work. Can't load a single webpage. (But I can do IRC, and download package updates!)
if you type in 'lspci | grep -i ether' does it mention anything?
let me try that
yep I get both my cards showing up, 1 is nvidia Ethernet Controller, the other is RTL-8139/8139C card
I guess the cards are detected, what confuses me is ifconfig returns eth0,eth1,sit0 what is sit0? I know the Nvidia ethernet card is on eth0.
eth0 is also connected to my DSL modem.
ha, I wondered about that for a while too. sit0 is a IPv6-over-IPv4 virtual tunnel thingy
ok, so the RTL card is eth1?
would assume it is.
probably.
Ok first thing is I tried bringing up dhcpd3 on eth1, and it says 'No subnet declaration for eth1 (0.0.0.0)'
... and 'Not configured to listen on any interfaces'. How can I fix that?
weird. so network autodetect doesn't work, and that's why you're using dhcpcd?
wait. you're using dhcpd or dhcpcd?
'dhcpcd' elicits an error.
dhcpd3 is a dhcp server thats what I use.
'cuz dhcpd3 (the one without the extra 'c') is a DHCP server, for when you want other machines to get their IP addresses from you
that is what I want. I have another PC wired to eth1
oh, so you're aware of that. sounds like your setup is a lot more complex than I'm used to...
I want Ubuntu to hand out IP addresses on eth1. This means I need a dhcp server running on eth1.

but I think it's significant that dhcpd3 sez it's not configured to listen on any interfaces. you might want to research that... check out the server's config files... mind you, if you can't even get eth0 up, it's pointless, unless you want a cozy little local network, I guess ;)
eth0 is up. I just cant use Firefox. I am using eth0 right now with a dsl modem to chat w/ you guys
